name: Eduardo David
title: Front-End Developer
introduction: There are many programming languages but, at the end, the best language for the best developer is not machine but human. I believe in teaching and learning, in communication and cooperation to evolve together and create something great.

clients.name: Model Bank (ING Spain)
clients.description: I entered first ING Spain to work in the page the Call Center agents use, with Backbone + Marionette, stylus, ... Then I moved to Model Bank to work on the clients page too. After some months the company started a new project with Polymer (lit-html), Redux, ... Alongside I also used with HTML, CSS, git, Jenkins, ...

clients.name: Internal Project
clients.description: They wanted a POC with Angular2 for a project the company had with BBVA, to manage things internally. So I self-learned Angular2 and made it.

clients.name: Caser Seguros
clients.description: Using mostly angular the client wanted to make a test to know how the clients have felt about some service the insurance company had provided.

clients.name: Internal Project
clients.description: After taking an education on front techonologies we used some of them (Angular, Sass, Gulp, Ionic, Git, ...) to build a mobile app they wanted to sell to an insurance company for people having a healthier life.

clients.name: Banco Santander
clients.description: The first project I become part of was for Leasing & Renting. We developed it cooperating with other companies, with a tech stack made of Java, Spring, Maven and Subversion for the version control.

experience.name: Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (Distributed Systems Department)
experience.description: The main pilar of the project was Zookeeper. We wanted to create a distributed architecture that will always mantain a correct state no matter what. We used a linux environment, Java, gradle, keep-alive, ...
